habitat_description:
Populations occur discontinuously across southern Nevada, southern California, Utah, west-central Colorado, Arizona, southern New Mexico, and Texas. In northern Mexico, populations have been reported in Chihuahua, Coahuila, and Sonora (Cole and Hardy 1981; 1983; Natureserve.org; Stebbins 2003). This semifossorial and elusive snake travel in the open during night time. It burrows in or using soil, fallen logs, or leaf litter.

In general, its range is dominated by desert, grassland, herbaceous habitats, savanna, chaparral, shrubland, conifer woodland, hardwood woodland, mixed woodland, and riparian habitats (Natureserve.org). Habitats consist of mesquite-yucca grassland, pinyon-juniper woodland, and riparian woodland. Other plant communities include cedar, ocotillo, persimmon and shin oak, creosote bush, and cacti (Cole and Hardy 1983; Stebbins 2003; Werler and Dixon 2000).


SW-	This species occurs among associations of ocotillo, mesquite, cedar, oak woodland, creosote bush, and other plants typical of arid to semiarid grasslands.
